newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures close narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures close narrowly mixed.

text.p: Rubber futures ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on some late buying and selling interest in line with mixed prices in Japan, brokers said on Wednesday.
"The market was quiet and featureless in the morning on lack of fresh factors. But prices turned mixed in the afternoon in sympathy with mixed prices in Tokyo and Kobe," a broker said.
Reports that the U.S. Defense National Stockpile Center is planning to start selling surplus natural rubber early next year had little impact on the market.
"Nobody talked about it at all," one broker said.
"There's no effect on the market yet but we will be waiting to see what happens next year when they start selling," another broker said.
At around 0945 GMT, October RSS3 rose 0.25 cent to 128.50 U.S. cents a kg.
October RSS1 eased half a cent to 185.00 Singapore cents (US$1.31) a kg.
September TSR20 rose one cent to 175.00 Singapore cents (US$1.24) a kg.
